name: Puget Sound region, Washington, United States

records.notes: A Lake City bound King County Metro Route 20 articulated bus was seen at NE 45th St & University Way NE in the University District.

An Edmonds bound Community Transit Route 871 articulated bus was seen at NE 45th St & 7th Ave NE in the University District. It is the last day that Community Transit 800-series commuter routes served the University of Washington prior to the [fall 2021 service change](https://www.communitytransit.org/alert/a45eb47e-2394-4e42-9ccc-dc9bb373a6a8).

An out-of-service Community Transit articulated bus was seen at NE 45th St & 7th Ave NE in the University District. It would be assigned as a Marysville bound Community Transit Route 821 later. It is the last day that Community Transit 800-series commuter routes served the University of Washington prior to the [fall 2021 service change](https://www.communitytransit.org/alert/a45eb47e-2394-4e42-9ccc-dc9bb373a6a8).

[SPECIAL] A University District bound King County Metro Route 271 articulated bus was seen at NE Campus Pkwy & University Way NE in the University District. Since Montlake Bridge was closed for construction during August 9 and September 5, 2021, transit service crossing the bridge was rerouted. See [Metro Matters news](https://kingcountymetro.blog/2021/08/03/rider-alert-get-ready-for-month-long-montlake-bridge-closure/) and [service advisories](https://kingcounty.gov/~/media/depts/metro/data/service-advisories/pdf/21-271-00-rts271-st542-montlake-bridge-clsr-aug19-sep5.pdf).

Due to Snoqualmie Railroad Days during this weekend, transit service was rerouted in both directions off a portion of Railroad Ave SE. See [service advisories](https://kingcounty.gov/~/media/depts/metro/data/service-advisories/pdf/21-spe-103-rt208-snoq-railroad-days-aug28-29.pdf).

[SPECIAL] A University of Washington bound King County Metro Link Shuttle articulated bus was seen at 3rd Ave & Pine St in Downtown Seattle. The shuttle operated between University of Washington Station and SODO Station on that weekend, as Link Line 1 was closed due to the construction of Link Line 2. See [service alerts](https://www.soundtransit.org/get-to-know-us/news-events/news-releases/link-to-close-between-uw-sodo-each-weekend-april). It was extremely rare to see the internal route number of Link Shuttle, 97, on the bus headsign.

An Everett bound Sound Transit Route 512 double-decker was seen at NE 45th St Fwy Station.
A Rainier Valley bound King County Metro Route 7 articulated bus was seen at 4th Ave & Pine St in Downtown Seattle.
A Downtown Seattle bound Sound Transit Route 594 bus was seen at Olive Way & 5th Ave in Downtown Seattle.

[SPECIAL] A University District bound King County Metro Route 70 trolleybus was seen at Fairview Ave N & Valley St. It was not usual to assign a single-section trolleybus to Route 70. Before the closure of Fairview Ave N wooden bridge, northbound trolleybuses used battery to run along Fairview Ave N between Aloha St and E Garfield St, as trolley poles needed to be lowered.
